title: Extras: Revisiting Property, Commercial & Broker Conduct Quiz

questions.question: Under Statutory Condition Misrepresentation, which of the following is NOT considered to be sufficient to VOID the policy? Hint
options: The property to be insured is described as brick construction but upon inspection it is brick veneer

In the investigation of a loss caused by faulty wiring, it is discovered that the insured had stated on the application form that the building was 60 amp wiring, while really it is only 100 amp wiring
The insured has stated in the application that the property is protected by an approved sprinkler system, but there is no sprinkler system protecting this property
The insured had not disclosed previous claims and in fact had omitted to inform of any losses, but there was one previous loss which would have affected the decision to write this risk

questions.question: Included within the definition of domestic water container would be: Hint
options: Hot tub, sink
Hot tub, bathtub
Fridge
All of the above

questions.question: As an insurance broker you must communicate all factual statements about a risk to an underwriter so that the risk can be properly assessed. This duty of disclosure:
options: Is fundamental to the principle of utmost good faith that underlies all insurance transactions
Does not impact the insurer
Falls solely on the shoulders of the applicant and broker
Requires accurate transmission of the risk particulars to the insured

questions.question: A material fact is one which the insured must disclose relevant information to the Broker acting as an intermediary to the Insurer. Material facts:
options: Contributes to the description of the risk
Could influence the acceptance of the risk
Must be disclosed by law
Refers to all key information

options: The evacuation is ordered by someone who is responsible
The evacuation is as a result of sudden and accidental event and insured peril under the policy
The perils which causes the evacuation must be an insured peril under the policy
The insured cannot safely return to their home

questions.question: A tenants package policy is issued to an insured who:
options: Owns his or her own home which is occupied by tenants
Owns his or her own home and wants insurance on the building only
Rents accomodation from others and wants contents and liability coverage
Wishes to insure his or her household goods which are temporarily in storage in a warehouse

questions.question: Which of the following is an underwriting concern with respect to rented dwellings?
options: The owner and renter may not be forthcoming about their financial status
The owner maintains and reports the condition of the premises to the insurer
When short-term occupancies are normally held in the unit
All of the above

questions.question: We are quoting to insure a warehouse. Which of the following is NOT an example of real property, also called fixed property?
options: A commercial warehouse
The parking lot
Equipment for use within the warehouse
A storage shed for off-season goods

questions.question: A loss payee is someone other than the named insured who will receive proceeds after a claim under an insurance policy. Which statement is TRUE respecting the mortgagee / loss payee?
options: If the policy is cancelled mid-term, the insurer will provide a notice of cancellation to the loss payee
If there is a transfer of interest, the loss payee must notify the insurer
Additional premium will be required if there is an increase in hazard and the insured refuses to pay the additional premium
All of the above are true

questions.question: Which of the following is true with regard to mobile home package policies?
options: Losses are settled on replacement cost basis with the exception of windstorm and hail losses
All furnishings are considered to be part of the building
It is identical to the basic homeowners policies except it covers mobile homes
Loss or damage that occurs while the building is being moved is not covered

questions.question: On a farm insurance policy, if an outbuilding is damaged to more than two-thirds of its value, an initial payment of up to 50% will be made. The remaining balance is payable if:
options: It is repaired or replaced withing three months of the date of loss
It is replaced with a building designed for the same purpose
It is replaced on the exact location where the damaged building was situated
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following exclusions apply to Commercial Building, Equipment and Stock form:
options: Nuclear incident or radioactive contamination
Act of foreign enemy
Loss or damage as a result of temperature changes, dampness or dryness of the atmosphere
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true? A loss ratio is:
options: The relationship expressed as a percentage between incurred losses and earned premium for a specified period
A comparison between the subject of insurance and the object of insurance
Not a factor when considering risk insurability

questions.question: Which statement is true regarding broker binding authority?
options: Binding authority is outlined in agency agreements
This may be authorized by some but not all insurers and differs between insurance companies
Authorizes an agent or broker to confirm coverage without first submitting the application to the insurance company underwriter
All of the above

questions.question: A broker has a fiduciary responsibility when handling insurance premiums. Even when there is no explicit requirement to keep funds separate, the broker should:
options: Hold premiums in a trust account separate from the general or operating bank account
Keep a good record of all premiums owed to the insurer and submit collected premiums promptly
Not earn interest on collected premiums
Aggressively invest collected premiums to maximize return on investment

questions.question: Your client, Groot Contracting Inc calls early on a Monday morning to report a loss that occurred over the weekend. One of their cranes fell at a project site. What is your immediate role as a Broker?
options: Report the loss to the insurer
Provide your client a proof of loss form
Assign an independent adjuster
All of the above

questions.question: Salvage is the portion of any property remaining after a loss which has some value or usefulness. An adjuster may allow the insured to keep salvage but the claims cost would be reduced ty the salvage value. A reasonable price would be charged. This is preferable to selling the items at an auction or private sale. Adjusters must be careful to record all details. Salvage:
options: Is the portion of any property remaining after a loss that has value
Belongs to the insured once the clam is settled
Increases cost of a claim
May be purchased by the insurer for reasonable cost
